question: You are a code expert. Please use your professional knowledge to generate accurate, professional responses. Be careful to ensure the code you generate is executable for display. Create an HTML webpage about Gravity Falls.

checklist.title: Is the Gravity Falls theme authentically represented?
checklist.description: Review whether the webpage accurately captures the Gravity Falls aesthetic through proper use of the show's visual elements, color palette (forest greens, mystery blues, rustic browns), and thematic content. Check for inclusion of iconic elements like the Mystery Shack, Bill Cipher symbols, journal pages, or woodland mystery themes. Score 0 if generic content with no show connection, 5 if basic theme elements present, and 10 if fully immersive Gravity Falls atmosphere with authentic visual references.

checklist.title: Is the content structure comprehensive and well-organized?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the webpage includes comprehensive Gravity Falls content such as character profiles (Dipper, Mabel, Grunkle Stan, etc.), episode guides, mystery elements, or interactive features. Check for proper HTML semantic structure with appropriate headings, sections, and navigation. Deduct 3 points if content is superficial, 5 points if navigation is confusing or missing, and 3 points if semantic HTML structure is poor. Full score requires rich, well-structured content.

checklist.title: Are interactive elements and animations implemented effectively?
checklist.description: Check whether the webpage includes engaging interactive features that enhance the Gravity Falls experience, such as hover effects on mystery symbols, clickable journal entries, character animations, or hidden easter eggs. Evaluate JavaScript implementation for smooth interactions. Deduct 5 points if interactions are buggy or non-functional, 3 points if animations are choppy, and 5 points if no interactive elements exist. Full score requires polished, theme-appropriate interactivity.

checklist.title: Is the multimedia integration properly implemented?
checklist.description: Assess whether images, videos, audio, or other media elements are properly integrated and optimized. Check for appropriate alt text, proper file formats, responsive image handling, and loading performance. Verify that media enhances the Gravity Falls theme rather than generic placeholder content. Deduct 3 points for missing alt text, 5 points for poor loading performance, and 3 points for inappropriate or low-quality media. Full score requires optimized, thematic multimedia integration.

checklist.title: Is the code robust and error-free?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the code can handle common issues such as missing images, JavaScript errors, responsive breakpoints, and browser compatibility. Code should include proper error handling, fallbacks for missing resources, and graceful degradation. Strong robustness earns 10 points. Average robustness with some error handling gets 5 points. No error handling or frequent crashes gets 0 points.

checklist.title: Are there innovative features that enhance user engagement?
checklist.description: Check for creative features that go beyond basic webpage functionality, such as: 1) Interactive mystery-solving elements 2) Character voice clips or sound effects 3) Hidden cipher puzzles 4) Parallax scrolling effects 5) Interactive timeline or episode navigator. Add 3 points for each well-implemented innovative feature (maximum 10 points). Features must be functional and add genuine value to the user experience.

checklist.title: Are there any redundant or unnecessary features?
checklist.description: Strictly check for three types of redundancy: 1) Duplicate functionality (multiple navigation systems) 2) Off-theme elements unrelated to Gravity Falls 3) Performance-heavy effects that don't serve the content (excessive animations, auto-playing videos). Deduct 3 points for each redundancy found. Deduct 10 points directly if redundant code significantly impacts core functionality or page performance.

checklist.title: Does the code demonstrate professional engineering quality?
checklist.description: Review code organization, proper HTML/CSS/JavaScript structure, commenting, and maintainability. Check for separation of concerns (HTML structure, CSS styling, JavaScript behavior), proper file organization, and clean code practices. Deduct 5 points for inline styles or scripts mixing concerns; deduct 5 points for code duplication over 30%; deduct 5 points for poor naming conventions or lack of comments. Full score requires professional-grade code structure.

checklist.title: Does the visual design meet professional aesthetic standards?
checklist.description: Evaluate overall design quality following modern web design principles: 1) Cohesive color scheme reflecting Gravity Falls palette (no more than 4 primary colors) 2) Proper typography hierarchy and readability (minimum 16px body text, 1.4+ line height) 3) Consistent spacing and alignment (preferably 8px grid system) 4) Professional layout composition. Deduct 3 points for each cluttered visual section, 5 points for poor color harmony, and 5 points for illegible text or chaotic layout.

checklist.title: Is the user experience smooth and intuitive?
checklist.description: Judge whether interactions feel natural and responsive: 1) Page load time under 3 seconds 2) Smooth scrolling and transitions (300-500ms duration) 3) Clear visual feedback for interactive elements 4) Intuitive navigation flow 5) Mobile responsiveness. Deduct 5 points for each unresponsive interaction, 3 points for jarring transitions or layout shifts, and 5 points for poor mobile experience or difficult-to-find navigation elements.
